DataElement.preferredDefinition: Date on which the acquisition of the imaging was completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Computed Tomography Exam
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition based on metabolic activity measured by a positron emission tomography (PET) and examination by scanning with X rays using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.

Property.preferredDefinition: An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.  2. The process by which a patient's condition is appraised or evaluated. (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a clinician that is based on a physical exam, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/10/13 Removed caBIG-ACRIN CSI; added equivalent ECOG-ACRIN CSI. jc  10/14/10 released as part of draft CDE cleanup activity.   2/18/08 revised for OC change to "PET CT".  8/14/07 Created to support curation of ACRIN PET CDEs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The place in time that any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic  happens.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Time meaning: Like time, date, frequency, occurence,..etc

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic.:Event; something that happens at a given place and time.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: Any record of a medical imaging event whether physical or electronic.
Something that happens at a given place and time.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
